title: Man allegedly made bomb threats to Everett city councilor
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Scott Merchant, 36, from Salisbury, pleaded not guilty to making bomb threats to an Everett city councilor.
The FBI alerted local police about the threats, leading to Merchant's arrest with assistance from law enforcement.
Merchant faces charges of bomb threat and threat to commit a crime; a bail hearing is scheduled for Thursday.

title: Here’s why there are American flags above gates B32 and C19 at Boston Logan Airport
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: American flags at gates B32 and C19 at Logan Airport honor the 9/11 victims and flights that departed from these gates.
Flags were placed by airline and airport employees shortly after 9/11 as a tribute without formal ceremonies or markers.
Additional flags now fly at gates B11 and B27, reflecting airline terminal changes, maintaining the tribute's presence.

title: MassINC poll: Just over half of voters approve of Healey’s performance
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: 56% of Massachusetts residents approve of Gov. Maura Healey's performance, according to a MassINC poll.
Healey's highest approval ratings come from Democrats, college-educated voters, and women over 50, while lowest from Southeastern Mass.
In comparison, Donald Trump has a 48% strong disapproval rating among Massachusetts residents, significantly lower than Healey's approval.

title: Where to find college student discounts in Greater Boston
author: Frances Klemm, Nia Harmon and Laura Emde
bullets: AMC Theatres offers special student pricing at select locations in Boston with valid student ID for ticket purchases.
Students can access $20 rush tickets for Boston Ballet performances at Citizens Bank Opera House with ID.
Amtrak provides a 15% discount for students aged 17-24 who book at least one day in advance.

title: ‘It’s a cornerstone of who we are’: Read Rep. Lori Trahan’s letter to Market Basket board
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Rep. Lori Trahan expressed disappointment in a letter regarding the ousting of Market Basket CEO Arthur T. Demoulas.
Demoulas was removed following allegations of orchestrating a work stoppage and tensions with his sisters, majority stakeholders.
Trahan emphasized Market Basket's significance in her community, urging the board to consider the store's legacy and impact.

title: What Jabrill Peppers said about his surprising release from the Patriots
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Jabrill Peppers, 29, was released by the Patriots last month despite signing a contract extension the previous year.
Patriots coach Mike Vrabel cited the release as in the team's best interest but didn't elaborate further.
Peppers signed with the Pittsburgh Steelers, expressing eagerness to learn their defensive scheme and play under Coach Mike Tomlin.

title: Mark Wahlberg is filming a new movie on the North Shore
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Mark Wahlberg is filming 'Weekend Warriors' in Lynn, Massachusetts, with production expected to continue through October.
'Weekend Warriors,' directed by Stephen Chbosky, follows a father and his autistic son traveling to NBA games.
The movie is produced by LeBron James's SpringHill and also stars Vera Farmiga and child actor Indie DesRoches.

title: What’s the deal with this art installation near South Station made entirely of coolers?
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Artist Victor 'Marka27' Quiñonez's installation 'Elevar La Cultura' features gold-painted coolers near South Station in Boston.
The artwork, honoring street vendors and undocumented workers, includes features like mirrors, marigold garlands, and symbols of immigrant cultures.
Coolers depict critiques of U.S. immigration policy, with faux ICE signs and altered U.S. seals; on display until December.

title: FBI releases photos of person of interest in Charlie Kirk’s assassination
author: The Associated Press
bullets: FBI releases photos of person of interest in Charlie Kirk's assassination, seeking public help for identification.
Charlie Kirk shot by a sniper at Utah Valley University; a Mauser .30 caliber rifle was recovered nearby.
Trump praises Kirk as a 'martyr for truth', announces the awarding of the Presidential Medal of Freedom.

title: Paul Pierce said Jayson Tatum’s injury ‘made it easier’ for Celtics to move Holiday, Porzingis
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Paul Pierce believes Jayson Tatum's injury made it easier for Celtics to trade Jrue Holiday and Kristaps Porzingis.
Celtics traded Porzingis to the Hawks and Holiday to Portland to avoid luxury tax penalties.
Celtics are ranked 12th in the Eastern Conference amid Tatum's absence and major roster changes.
